subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Jaromir Jagr, who left the Rangers last month to sign with the Russian league team Avangard Omsk, received the Golden Stick award as the top hockey player from the Czech Republic for the fourth consecutive year and a record ninth time over all. Jagr, 36, finished ahead of Montreal Canadiens forward Tomas Plekanec and Toronto Maple Leafs defenseman Tomas Kaberle in the voting.
